verses.verse: “I (Rev. 1:7; Matt. 1:2; Luke 3:34) see Him, but not now; I behold Him, but not near; (Matt. 2:2) A Star shall come out of Jacob; (Gen. 49:10) A Scepter shall rise out of Israel, And batter the brow of Moab, And destroy all the sons of tumult.
“And (2 Sam. 8:14) Edom shall be a possession; Seir also, his enemies, shall be a possession, While Israel does valiantly.
(Gen. 49:10; Amos 9:11, 12) Out of Jacob One shall have dominion, And destroy the remains of the city.”
Then he looked on Amalek, and he took up his oracle and said: “Amalek was first among the nations, But shall be last until he perishes.”
Then he looked on the Kenites, and he took up his oracle and said: “Firm is your dwelling place, And your nest is set in the rock;
Nevertheless Kain shall be burned. How long until Asshur carries you away captive?”
Then he took up his oracle and said: “Alas! Who shall live when God does this?
But ships shall come from the coasts of (Gen. 10:4; Ezek. 27:6; Dan. 11:30) Cyprus, And they shall afflict Asshur and afflict (Gen. 10:21, 25) Eber, And so shall Amalek, until he perishes.”
So Balaam rose and departed and (Num. 22:5; 31:8) returned to his place; Balak also went his way.
Israel’s Harlotry in Moab Now Israel remained in (Num. 33:49; Josh. 2:1) Acacia Grove, and the (Rev. 2:14) people began to commit harlotry with the women of Moab.
(Josh. 22:17; Hos. 9:10) They invited the people to (Ex. 34:15; Deut. 32:38; 1 Cor. 10:20) the sacrifices of their gods, and the people ate and (Ex. 20:5) bowed down to their gods.
So Israel was joined to Baal of Peor, and (Ps. 106:28, 29) the anger of the LORD was aroused against Israel.

Then the LORD said to Moses, (Deut. 4:3) “Take all the leaders of the people and hang the offenders before the LORD, out in the sun, (Num. 25:11; Deut. 13:17) that the fierce anger of the LORD may turn away from Israel.”
So Moses said to (Ex. 18:21) the judges of Israel, (Deut. 13:6, 9) “Every one of you kill his men who were joined to Baal of Peor.”

And indeed, one of the children of Israel came and presented to his brethren a Midianite woman in the sight of Moses and in the sight of all the congregation of the children of Israel, (Joel 2:17) who were weeping at the door of the tabernacle of meeting.
Now (Ps. 106:30) when Phinehas (Ex. 6:25) the son of Eleazar, the son of Aaron the priest, saw it, he rose from among the congregation and took a javelin in his hand;

and he went after the man of Israel into the tent and thrust both of them through, the man of Israel, and the woman through her body. So (Ps. 106:30) the plague was (Num. 16:46-48) stopped among the children of Israel.
And (Deut. 4:3) those who died in the plague were twenty-four thousand.
